items.title: Awesome Fiber Updates on May 28, 2023
items.content_text:
### âš™ï¸ Middlewares / ğŸ§¬ Core

*   [Adaptor (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/adaptor) - Converter for net/http handlers to/from Fiber request handlers.
*   [Earlydata (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/earlydata) - Early data support for Fiber.
*   [Helmet (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/helmet) - Helps secure your apps by setting various HTTP headers.
*   [Idempotency (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/idempotency) - Idempotency middleware for Fiber allows for fault-tolerant APIs where duplicate requests.
*   [Keyauth (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/keyauth) - Key auth middleware provides a key based authentication.
*   [Redirect (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/redirect) - Redirect middleware for Fiber.
*   [Rewrite (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/rewrite) - Rewrite middleware rewrites the URL path based on provided rules. It can be helpful for backward compatibility or just creating cleaner and more descriptive links.
items.content_html:
âš™ï¸ Middlewares / ğŸ§¬ Core

  • Adaptor (â­37k) - Converter for net/http handlers to/from Fiber request handlers.
  • Earlydata (â­37k) - Early data support for Fiber.
  • Helmet (â­37k) - Helps secure your apps by setting various HTTP headers.
  • Idempotency (â­37k) - Idempotency middleware for Fiber allows for fault-tolerant APIs where duplicate requests.
  • Keyauth (â­37k) - Key auth middleware provides a key based authentication.
  • Redirect (â­37k) - Redirect middleware for Fiber.
  • Rewrite (â­37k) - Rewrite middleware rewrites the URL path based on provided rules. It can be helpful for backward compatibility or just creating cleaner and more descriptive links.

### ğŸš§ Boilerplates / ğŸŒ± Third Party

*   [gofiber/boilerplate (â­477)](https://github.com/gofiber/boilerplate) - Official fiber boilerplate.
*   [fiber-boilerplate (â­284)](https://github.com/thomasvvugt/fiber-boilerplate) - A boilerplate for the Fiber web framework.
*   [sujit-baniya/fiber-boilerplate (â­424)](https://github.com/sujit-baniya/fiber-boilerplate) - Boilerplate on the top of fiber web framework with many middlewares and features.
*   [create-go-app/fiber-go-template (â­1k)](https://github.com/create-go-app/fiber-go-template) - Fiber backend template for Create Go App CLI.
*   [embedmode/fiberseed (â­40)](https://github.com/embedmode/fiberseed) - Fiber boilerplate api with many middlewares.

### ğŸ“ Recipes / ğŸŒ± Third Party

*   [kiyonlin/fiblar-demo (â­3)](https://github.com/kiyonlin/fiblar-demo) - Fiber v1 + angular demo.
*   [koddr/tutorial-go-fiber-rest-api (â­396)](https://github.com/koddr/tutorial-go-fiber-rest-api) - Tutorial for building a restful api with fiber.
*   [firebase007/go-rest-api-with-fiber (â­57)](https://github.com/firebase007/go-rest-api-with-fiber) - Demo project with fiber, logging, basicAuth and postgresql.
*   [chawk/go\_fiber\_quickstart (â­18)](https://github.com/chawk/go_fiber_quickstart) - Fiber quick start example project.
*   [EricLau1/go-fiber-auth-api (â­55)](https://github.com/EricLau1/go-fiber-auth-api) - Golang Authentication API with Fiber MongoDB and JWT.

### ğŸ¤– Benchmarks / ğŸŒ± Third Party

*   [TechEmpower](https://www.techempower.com/benchmarks/#section=data-r20\&hw=ph\&test=json) - Project provides performance measures across a wide field of web application frameworks.
*   [web-frameworks-benchmark](https://web-frameworks-benchmark.netlify.app/result) - Project aims to measure the differences between the various programming language frameworks.
*   [go-web-framework-benchmark (â­2.1k)](https://github.com/smallnest/go-web-framework-benchmark) - This benchmark suite aims to compare the performance of Go web frameworks.

items.title: Awesome Fiber Updates on Feb 28, 2022
items.content_text:
### âš™ï¸ Middlewares / ğŸ§¬ Core

*   [BasicAuth (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/basicauth) - Basic auth middleware provides an HTTP basic authentication. It calls the next handler for valid credentials and 401 Unauthorized for missing or invalid credentials.
*   [Cache (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/cache) - Intercept and cache responses.
*   [CORS (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/cors) - Enable cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) with various options.
*   [CSRF (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/csrf) - Protect from CSRF exploits.
*   [Encrypt Cookie (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/encryptcookie) - Encrypt middleware which encrypts cookie values.
*   [ETag (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/etag) - ETag middleware that lets caches be more efficient and save bandwidth, as a web server does not need to resend a full response if the content has not changed.
*   [Expvar (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/expvar) - Expvar middleware that serves via its HTTP server runtime exposed variants in the JSON format.
*   [Favicon (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/favicon) - Ignore favicon from logs or serve from memory if a file path is provided.
*   [FileSystem (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/filesystem) - FileSystem middleware for Fiber, special thanks and credits to Alireza Salary.
*   [Limiter (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/limiter) - Rate-limiting middleware. Use to limit repeated requests to public APIs and/or endpoints such as password reset.
*   [Logger (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/logger) - HTTP request/response logger.
*   [Monitor (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/monitor) - Monitor middleware that reports server metrics, inspired by express-status-monitor.
*   [Pprof (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/pprof) - Pprof middleware that serves via its HTTP server runtime profiling data in the format expected by the pprof visualization tool.
*   [Proxy (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/proxy) - Allows you to proxy requests to a multiple servers.
*   [Recover (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/recover) - Recover middleware recovers from panics anywhere in the stack chain and handles the control to the centralized ErrorHandler.
*   [RequestID (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/requestid) - Adds a requestid to every request.
*   [Session (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/session) - Session middleware. NOTE: This middleware uses our Storage package.
*   [Skip (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/skip) - Skip middleware that skips a wrapped handler is a predicate is true.
*   [Timeout (â­37k)](https://github.com/gofiber/fiber/tree/master/middleware/timeout) - Adds a max time for a request and forwards to ErrorHandler if it is exceeded.

### âš™ï¸ Middlewares / ğŸ”— External

*   [storage (â­298)](https://github.com/gofiber/storage) - Premade storage drivers that implement the Storage interface, designed to be used with various Fiber middlewares.
*   [template (â­294)](https://github.com/gofiber/template) - This package contains 8 template engines that can be used with Fiber v1.10.x Go version 1.13 or higher is required.

### âš™ï¸ Middlewares / â€ğŸ’» Contrib

*   [fibersentry (â­262)](https://github.com/gofiber/contrib/tree/main/fibersentry) - Sentry support for Fiber.
*   [fiberzap (â­262)](https://github.com/gofiber/contrib/tree/main/fiberzap) - Zap logging support for Fiber.
*   [otelfiber (â­262)](https://github.com/gofiber/contrib/tree/main/otelfiber) - OpenTelemetry support for Fiber.
*   [paseto (â­262)](https://github.com/gofiber/contrib/tree/main/paseto) - PASETO returns a Web Token (PASETO) auth middleware.
*   [swagger (â­262)](https://github.com/gofiber/contrib/tree/main/swagger) - Swagger middleware for Fiber. The middleware handles Swagger UI.

### ğŸ“ Recipes / ğŸŒ± Third Party

*   [gofiber/recipes (â­3.3k)](https://github.com/gofiber/recipes) - Official Fiber cookbook.

### ğŸ› ï¸ Tools / ğŸŒ± Third Party

*   [go-dawn/dawn (â­19)](https://github.com/go-dawn/dawn) - Dawn is an opinionated web framework that provides rapid development capabilities which on top of Fiber.
*   [tompston/gomakeme (â­11)](https://github.com/tompston/gomakeme) - Generate boilerplate + endpoints for Fiber or Gin REST APIs.

### ğŸ“– Articles / ğŸŒ± Third Party

*   [Go Fiber by Examples: How can the Fiber Web Framework be useful?](https://dev.to/koddr/go-fiber-by-examples-how-can-the-fiber-web-framework-be-useful-487a)
*   [Build a RESTful API on Go: Fiber, PostgreSQL, JWT and Swagger docs in isolated Docker containers](https://dev.to/koddr/build-a-restful-api-on-go-fiber-postgresql-jwt-and-swagger-docs-in-isolated-docker-containers-475j)
*   [Getting started with Fiber](https://dev.to/fenny/getting-started-with-fiber-36b6)
*   [Fiber v1.9.6 How to improve performance by 817% and stay fast, flexible and friendly?](https://dev.to/koddr/fiber-v1-9-5-how-to-improve-performance-by-817-and-stay-fast-flexible-and-friendly-2dp6)
*   [Create a travel list app with Go, Fiber, Angular, MongoDB and Google Cloud Secret Manager](https://blog.yongweilun.me/create-a-travel-list-app-with-go-fiber-angular-mongodb-and-google-cloud-secret-manager-ck9fgxy0p061pcss1xt1ubu8t)
*   [Is switching from Express to Fiber worth it?](https://dev.to/koddr/are-sure-what-your-lovely-web-framework-running-so-fast-2jl1)
*   [Fiber v1.8. What's new, updated and re-thinked?](https://dev.to/koddr/fiber-v1-8-what-s-new-updated-and-re-thinked-339h)
*   [Fiber released v1.7! What's new and is it still fast, flexible and friendly?](https://dev.to/koddr/fiber-v2-is-out-now-what-s-new-and-is-he-still-fast-flexible-and-friendly-3ipf)
